channel.title: Homes on Research Associate at Imperial College London
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Research Associate at Imperial College London

item.description: Biography I am currently a Senior Research Scientist with Huawei Technologies working on Computer Vision and Machine Learning problems. Current research directions include computational photography challenges, multi-task learning and meta-learning. Previously I held postdoctoral posts with the Biomedical Image Analysis Group, Imperial College London, working with Dr. Ben Glocker, Dr. Bernhard Kainz and Professor Daniel Rueckert and formerly with Disney Research Zurich, working on real-time facial image capture. I earned my PhD at the University of Edinburgh in the Institute of Perception, Action and Behaviour under the supervision of Prof.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am a Teaching Assistant for the following course: CO-145 Mathematical Methods (UG1), Imperial College London (2017). Previously, I have also taught: Teaching Assistant: Machine Learning and Neural Computation (MSc), Imperial College London (2016). Guest lecturer: Advanced Computer Vision (UG4/MSc), Edinburgh (2014). Teaching Assistant: Advanced Computer Vision (UG4/MSc), Edinburgh (2012â€“2014). Teaching Assistant: Introduction to Vision and Robotics (UG3), Edinburgh (2011-2012).
